## AI & Data Center Stocks Performance YTD 2025

A look at the performance of key "AI / Data Center" stocks since the start of 2025. The chart below shows the cumulative returns of selected stocks in this sector, normalized to 0% on January 1, 2025.

```{python, echo=FALSE,warnings=FALSE, message=FALSE}
import yfinance as yf
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

# 1. Define the "AI / Data Center" Basket
# Feel free to add/remove tickers from this list
tickers = [
    'NVDA',  # Nvidia (AI Chips)
    'AMD',   # AMD (AI Chips)
    'VRT',   # Vertiv (Cooling & Power)
    'ANET',  # Arista (Networking)
    'SMCI',  # Super Micro (Server Racks)
    'EQIX',  # Equinix (Physical Data Centers)
    'DELL',  # Dell (AI Servers)
    'PLTR',  #Palantir(AI platform)
    'CRWV',  # Coreweave(Datacenters)
    'NBIS',  # Nebis(AI infrastructure)
    'AVGO',  # Broadcom(AI Chips,Datacenters)
    'CORZ',  # CoreSCientific(AI Datacenters)
    'IREN',  # Iren Limited(AI CLoud)
    'APLD',  # Applied Digital(AI Datacenters)
    'ALAB',  # Astera Labs(AI Chips) 
]

# 2. Download Data from Jan 1, 2025 to Today
print("Downloading data...")
# We use auto_adjust=True to account for any dividends/splits automatically
data = yf.download(tickers, start='2025-01-01', auto_adjust=True)['Close']

# 3. Check if data was retrieved successfully
if data.empty:
    print("No data found. Please check your internet connection or ticker symbols.")
else:
    # 4. Calculate Percentage Return (Relative to Day 1)
    # Formula: (Price / Start_Price - 1) * 100
    # This makes every stock start at 0% on Jan 1st
    normalized_returns = (data / data.iloc[0] - 1) * 100

    # 5. Plotting
    plt.figure(figsize=(14, 7))
    
    # Loop through columns to plot each ticker
    for ticker in normalized_returns.columns:
        # Plot only if we have data for the ticker
        plt.plot(normalized_returns.index, normalized_returns[ticker], label=ticker, linewidth=2)

    # Styling the Plot
    plt.title('AI & Data Center Stock Returns (YTD 2025)', fontsize=16)
    plt.xlabel('.', fontsize=12)
    plt.ylabel('Cumulative Return (%)', fontsize=12)
    plt.axhline(0, color='black', linewidth=1, linestyle='--') # Add a zero line
    plt.legend(loc='upper left', fontsize=10)
    plt.grid(True, alpha=0.3)
    
    # Format x-axis dates nicely
    plt.gcf().autofmt_xdate()
    #plt.figtext(0.02, 0.02, 'Source: Yahoo Finance API(created by jamesstats)', color='gray') 

     
    
    plt.show()

    # Optional: Print the final return values sorted
    final_returns = normalized_returns.iloc[-1].sort_values(ascending=False)
    print("\n--- Performance Since Jan 1, 2025 ---")
    print(final_returns.round(2).astype(str) + '%')
```
